## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been reading about Verus and I'm interested in learning more about its unique features. What is the significance of a simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launch in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, a simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launch means that a new blockchain is launched alongside a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This bridge converter liquidity pool is bound to the launch of the new blockchain and runs on it, earning fees on the new blockchain without any rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This allows for seamless connectivity between the two. It's a powerful feature that enables a lot of flexibility and efficiency in the Verus ecosystem. Do you have any other questions about this topic?

**User:**
Actually, I do. How do blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches work in Verus, and what happens if minimum participation levels are not met?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches allow you to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on the chain. If the minimum levels are not met by the start time of your blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all their pre-conversions, minus network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation, pre-launch discounts, and price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs, among other features. This makes it a very flexible and secure way to launch a new blockchain-based currency.

**User:**
That's really interesting. I've also heard about the multichain network in Verus. What is the significance of an interoperable, multichain network in Verus, and how does it enable unlimited scale?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus multichain network allows for the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains, enabling unlimited scale. This is made possible by Notary IDs, which provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, allowing public blockchains to be available for merge mining and staking. This enables new use cases and unlimited scalability in the Verus network. It's a game-changer in terms of what's possible with blockchain technology. Do you have any other questions about the Verus multichain network?
What is the significance of a simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launch in Verus?

In Verus, a simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launch means that a new blockchain is launched alongside a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This bridge converter liquidity pool is bound to the launch of the new blockchain and runs on it, earning fees on the new blockchain without any rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This allows for seamless connectivity between the two.

## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well.
## An interoperable, multichain network for new use cases and unlimited scale**
- The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as

The Verus multichain network allows for the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains, enabling unlimited scale.
